verbs.description: indulge (third-person singular simple present indulges, present participle indulging, simple past and past participle indulged)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, often followed by "in"): To yield to a temptation or desire.
examples: He looked at the chocolate but didn't indulge.
I indulged in drinking on the weekend.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To satisfy the wishes or whims of.
examples: Grandma indulges the kids with sweets.
I love to indulge myself with beautiful clothes.

entries.meaning: To give way to (a habit or temptation); to not oppose or restrain.
examples: to indulge sloth, pride, selfishness, or inclinations

entries.meaning: To grant an extension to the deadline of a payment.
To grant as by favour; to bestow in concession, or in compliance with a wish or request.
